discussion.content:
correct answer is C, because
R1(config)#snmp-server group MYGROUP v3 ?
 auth group using the authNoPriv Security Level
 noauth group using the noAuthNoPriv Security Level
 priv group using SNMPv3 authPriv security level

correct answer is C, because
R1(config)#snmp-server group MYGROUP ?
 v1 group using the v1 security model
 v2c group using the v2c security model
 v3 group using the User Security Model (SNMPv3)

questions.question_text: Which parameter in an SNMPv3 configuration offers authentication and encryption?
Which IPv6 address type is seen as the next-hop address in the output of the show ipv6 rip RIPng database command?
In IPv6, SLAAC provides the ability to address a host based on a network prefix that is advertised from a local network router. How is the prefix advertised?
A network engineer is considering enabling load balancing with EIGRP. Which consideration should be analyzed?

choices.D: By default, EIGRP performs equal cost load balancing at least across four equal cost paths. D
choices.A: EIGRP allows a maximum of four paths across for load balancing traffic.
choices.C: EIGRP unequal path load balancing can result in routing loops.
choices.B: By default, EIGRP uses a default variance of 2 for load balancing.

choices.A: RADIUS uses TCP, and TACACS+ uses UDP.
choices.D: TACACS+ separates authentication and authorization. D
choices.B: RADIUS encrypts the entire body of the packet.
choices.C: TACACS+ encrypts only the password portion of a packet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer
